content.title: Popliteal Artery Aneurysm
content.description: The most common peripheral arterial aneurysm, predominantly affecting older males, with high risk of thrombosis and distal embolization rather than rupture.
content.epidemiology: Male:female ratio 30:1, mean age 65, bilateral in 50%, associated AAA in 30-50%
content.pathophysiology: Degenerative process, possibly related to repetitive knee flexion trauma. High rates of mural thrombus formation and distal embolization.

surgical_options: Medial approach with ligation and bypass
treatment.key_factor: Patent runoff vessels critical for outcome
